isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - Meritor Medium Duty Front Drive Steer Axle - Removal and Disassembly - Remove Steering Knuckle from Axle Housing

svcproc.title: Remove Steering Knuckle from Axle Housing
svcproc.para: The steering arm and cross tube assemblies can be serviced without removing the steering knuckle from the housing.

step1.para: Remove the four capscrews and washers from the lower knuckle cap (Figure 22).
Remove the cap and inspect the thrust bearing for wear or damage. Replace a worn or damaged thrust bearing at reassembly (Figure 23).

figure.caption: Figure 23. Inspect Thrust Bearing for Wear or Damage

step1.para: Remove the six capscrews from the upper knuckle cap.
Remove the air chamber mounting bracket.
Lift the upper knuckle cap from the bore (Figure 24).
Inspect the upper knuckle cap for wear or damage.
After both the upper and lower knuckle cap are removed, pull the steering knuckle from the axle housing.
The bushings will remain in the sockets of the axle housing. Inspect the upper and lower bushings while they are still in the sockets for wear or damage (Figure 25).

figure.caption: Figure 25. Inspect Upper and Lower Bushings

step1.para: If necessary, remove the bushings and the socket plugs from the upper and lower sockets in the housing, using the following procedure.

step2.para: Drive the socket plug and bushing toward the outside of the socket using a sleeve that is slightly smaller than the socket bore (Figure 26).
Clean all grease and dirt from the bores before reassembly.

figure.caption: Figure 26. Drive Socket Plug and Bushing Toward Outside of Socket
